TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ScrollEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `Scroll` event occurs when the user changes the value of the scroll bar. This event can result from a variety of actions, such as clicking a scroll bar arrow, pressing the UP ARROW or DOWN ARROW, or dragging the scroll box. The ScrollEventArgs specifies the type of scroll event that occurred and the new value of the scroll bar. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.ScrollOrientation%2A> property to determine the scroll bar orientation for the `Scroll` event.
The `Scroll` event occurs for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> controls.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member.
[!code-vb[Classic ScrollBar.OnScroll Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.s_4_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Classic ScrollBar.OnScroll Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.s_4_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[Classic ScrollBar.OnScroll Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.s_4_1.cs)]

[!code-vb[Classic ScrollBar.OnScroll Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.s_26_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Classic ScrollBar.OnScroll Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.s_26_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[Classic ScrollBar.OnScroll Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.s_26_1.cs)]

Docs.value: The numeric value that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Value%2A> property contained before it changed.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.Scroll?displayProperty=fullName> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=fullName> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl>, such as a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl>. Then name the instance `ScrollableControl1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.Scroll?displayProperty=fullName> event.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#74](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.s_132_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#74](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.s_132_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the scroll bar orientation that raised the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You would typically use the ScrollOrientation property to determine the scroll bar orientation that raised the `Scroll` event, such as with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.Scroll?displayProperty=fullName> event.

Docs.summary: Gets the type of scroll event that occurred.
